intro: Cineraria glaberrima, commonly known as the woolly cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and vibrant blue or violet flowers. The plant belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Cineraria glaberrima is typically propagated through seeds or cuttings and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
